CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bernice Lee, 1050 Rivermont Dr., Glen-Hazel Heights, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "It seems as though the raids in the Negro neighborhoods are given more publicity than those in the white areas. I don't think there is more crime in the areas, but instead there may be a little prejudice."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bernice Lee wearing earrings, three strand necklace, and light colored short sleeve shirt, holding child's hand, standing on the corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Kappels store in background, Downtown
